target_markets.market_description: Content creators and influencers on social media platforms
pain_points: not being compensated for value added to platforms
lack of input in platform decisions
one-sided value exchange with social media companies
target_markets.market_size_indicators: 575,000 followers mentioned as example of substantial audience

problems_validated.problem: Social media creators add value to platforms but receive no direct compensation
problems_validated.severity: High - affects all content creators on major platforms
problems_validated.current_solutions: Traditional social media model where platforms show ads against content
problems_validated.market_gap: Creators have no direct revenue share or input in platform decisions despite adding significant value

products_tools.name: Twitter
products_tools.pricing: free for creators, revenue through advertising

products_tools.name: Cameo
products_tools.metrics: mentioned as part of creator economy rise

business_strategies.strategy: Creator revenue sharing model for social media platforms
business_strategies.implementation: Platforms should compensate creators based on value they add through followers and engagement
business_strategies.expected_results: More equitable value distribution between platforms and creators
business_strategies.case_study: Rise of companies like Cameo showing shift toward creator compensation

problems_solutions.problem: Social media platforms don't compensate valuable content creators
problems_solutions.solution: Implement revenue sharing or direct compensation models
steps: Include creators in platform decision making

startup_ideas.idea: Platform that directly compensates creators for their audience value
startup_ideas.target_market: Content creators frustrated with current social media compensation models
startup_ideas.problem_solved: Lack of direct compensation for value added to social platforms
startup_ideas.business_model: Revenue sharing between platform and creators
startup_ideas.validation: Growing creator economy and companies like Cameo show market demand

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Creating one-sided value exchange with content creators
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Creators may leave platform or reduce engagement
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Implement fair compensation and include creators in decision making
mistakes_to_avoid.example: Twitter's current model where creators add value but receive no direct compensation

metrics_kpis.optimization_tip: Focus on value creation to build engaged following

trends_signals.opportunity: Shift toward direct creator compensation models and platforms that share revenue with content creators

trends_signals.trend: Evolution of social media value exchange
trends_signals.opportunity: Original social media agreement of 'audience for content' is shifting toward creator compensation models

actionable_quotes.quote: the agreement was we will give you an audience and you in turn will give us content right and that's that's the deal right
actionable_quotes.context: Describing the original social media value proposition
actionable_quotes.actionability: Understanding the fundamental value exchange in social media platforms

actionable_quotes.quote: i think that concept has slowly shifted like i think the rise of the creator economy
actionable_quotes.context: Discussing how social media value exchange is evolving
actionable_quotes.actionability: Recognize and adapt to changing creator economy expectations

key_statistics.context: Example of substantial social media following that adds value to platform

meta.title: Should Twitter Be Writing You A Check? | Sriram Krishnan
